etymology.description: semantic 㣇 + abbreviated phonetic 胃
etymology.interpretation: 㣇 conveys the idea of gathering/bringing things together, matching the meaning of ‘collection/category’. 胃 (wèi) supplies the sound value huì in Old Chinese, guiding the pronunciation. In simplified Chinese, this meaning is written with 汇, which was standardized by merging with the simplified form of 匯/滙.
etymology.simplification: Adopted the existing simplified form 汇 (from 匯/滙 by removing 隹), merging 彙 and 匯 into the single simplified graph 汇 for ease and uniformity.

examples.chinese: 这本词典按主题分类词汇，方便查找。(這本詞典按主題分類詞彙，方便查找。)
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn cídiǎn àn zhǔtí fēnlèi cíhuì, fāngbiàn cházhǎo.
examples.english: This dictionary categorizes vocabulary by topic for easy lookup.

examples.chinese: 编辑正在汇编资料，准备出版专题合集。(編輯正在彙編資料，準備出版專題合集。)
examples.pinyin: Biānjí zhèngzài huìbiān zīliào, zhǔnbèi chūbǎn zhuāntí héjí.
examples.english: The editors are compiling materials to publish a themed collection.

examples.chinese: 我们把各地的案例汇集起来，做成一份报告。(我們把各地的案例彙集起來，做成一份報告。)
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bǎ gèdì de ànlì huìjí qǐlái, zuòchéng yí fèn bàogào.
examples.english: We gathered cases from various regions and made them into a report.
